conclusion: Determine temperature of state C using ideal gas properties and p-V diagram.
Cycle ABCDA is a closed loop, net work done is zero.
Temperature at state A is T0.
AB is isobaric, BC is isochoric, CD is isobaric, DA is isochoric.
Temperature at state C is proportional to pressure at state C compared to B.
Temperature at state B is proportional to volume at state B compared to A.
Temperature at state B is the same as temperature at state A.
Temperature at state C is the same as temperature at state B.
Temperature of state C is T0.
